newsitem.title: POLAND: SWARZEDZ SETS OFFER FOR CREDITORS.
newsitem.headline: SWARZEDZ SETS OFFER FOR CREDITORS.

text.p: Polish furniture maker Swarzedz SA plans to earmark 3.1 million shares of its new 6.6-million- share issue to creditors, the company said in a statement on Friday.
The firms' shareholders will vote on the new issue on June 6, it said.
It said new shares would be offered in four tranches, with 1.7 million earmarked for current shareholders, 1.3 tranche for large investors, 450,000 for all investors and 3.1 million for creditors.
The amount of shares particular creditors will get will depend on Swarzedz's liabilities to them. The rights issue will be alloted on a one-for-two basis.
The statement said the Polish Development Bank PBR would be entitled to buy up to 350,000 shares in the institutional tranche.
On Thursday, Swarzedz said it had signed a letter of intent on selling five percent of its new issue to German Schieder Group.
